InformativeText.Abstract: The level of an alert a device is to sound. If this level is changed while the alert is being sounded, the new level should take effect.
InformativeText.Summary: The value of the characteristic shall be an unsigned 8 bit integer that has a fixed point exponent of 0. The Alert Level characteristic defines the level of alert, and is one of the following three values: - Value 0, meaning "No Alert" - Value 1, meaning "Mild Alert" - Value 2, meaning "High Alert"

Examples.Example: The value 0x01 is interpreted as "Mild Alert"
